reviews.productTitle: Lutron Claro 15 Amp Single-Pole Rocker Switch with Locator Light, CA-1PSNL-WH, White
reviews.text: This switch bleeds current to the lights when it is off. Your lights will glow when they are supposed to be unpowered. I am using dimmable LED lights. Lutron's fix for this is you should buy a nine dollar capacitor and wire it in parallel with the switch. Perhaps engineering should fix their product to not cause ghosting. They should offer a recall and not charge you an extra nine dollars to fix it yourself.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2020
reviews.title: Bleeds current when off

reviews.productTitle: Lutron Claro 15 Amp Single-Pole Rocker Switch with Locator Light, CA-1PSNL-WH, White
reviews.text: The Amazon delivery person did a good delivery and was respectful of the property. The sender however, sent me an item which I found after opening the Amazon packaging, to have the original products box torn open. The item, a wall switch seemed undamaged, but exposed. It looks like it will function, but I don't know if it will do so properly, until I have had the time to install and test it. Lutron makes what I feel are some awesome switches, so I feel it should work out just fine .
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 27, 2020
reviews.title: This lutron switches are now being sold in little boxes rather than tough sealed plastic.

reviews.productTitle: Lutron Claro 15 Amp Single-Pole Rocker Switch with Locator Light, CA-1PSNL-WH, White
reviews.text: Easy to install, these new switches are a bit louder when turning on/off than the ones I have from like 10 or 15 years ago. The biggest drawback is the light locator. The old switches had a decently bright, but not too bright orange light that lit up most of the "on" side of the paddle switch. The new one sucks! The light is MUCH smaller like a little bar of light, located in the middle of the paddle and is so dim I can barely see it unless looking straight on. I put this around the corner from a door in a bedroom above a little alcove where a desk sits. I am afraid the light locator won't be able to be seen hardly at all from the side once I put the desk back. May have to swap this one with a much brighter older one from another room. VERY disappointed. How is it they redesigned this and SCREWED IT UP? The original models worked great. I won't be paying extra (i think it is more than double the cost of a standard paddle switch) for a feature that doesn't really work.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2020
reviews.title: Works, but old ones were MUCH better

reviews.productTitle: Lutron Claro 15 Amp Single-Pole Rocker Switch with Locator Light, CA-1PSNL-WH, White
reviews.text: I bought several of these switches in white to use in the bedrooms. The switches seem well constructed and sturdy. In comparison to the lit switches from Cooper and Leviton, these switches have the loudest click (snap) when toggling on and off. It was the first thing my wife noticed as she heard me testing it from the next room. Not a deal breaker, but something to be aware of. It sounds louder in person than in the video. Surprisingly, to me, the illumination is at the center of the toggle switch rather than in the center of the upper portion for On. The other brands position the lighting in the "normal" place. The lit spot is a smaller rectangle band rather than a larger square on the others. The lighting color is the same warm amber/dim orange on all three brands.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 29, 2018
reviews.title: Sturdy, clicky, lighted switch.

reviews.productTitle: Lutron Claro 15 Amp Single-Pole Rocker Switch with Locator Light, CA-1PSNL-WH, White
reviews.text: These Lytton switches are better than other brands. When you reach for this switch you find a high quality, sturdy product that gives you a satisfying "click" upon activation. Other popular switches feel flimsy to me, and I worry that they would fail under frequent use. One caveat about this Lutron: if you are looking for the night light feature to serve as you primary means of wayfinding in a darkened bathroom, this may not be for you. The button is illuminated, but just barely.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2017
reviews.title: Top quality switch

reviews.productTitle: Lutron Claro 15 Amp Single-Pole Rocker Switch with Locator Light, CA-1PSNL-WH, White
reviews.text: My original single pole switches worked well without a grounding wire (not available). If you try to use this switch without one, the lights will always stay on but very dimly. I assume it's because there's a high resistance path to ground through the active and load sides to power the dim light on the switch.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2017
reviews.title: Doesn't work well without a grounding wire.

reviews.productTitle: Lutron Claro 15 Amp Single-Pole Rocker Switch with Locator Light, CA-1PSNL-WH, White
reviews.text: I bought several different illuminated switches through my spouse's Amazon Prime account. I wanted to determine which best fit my needs before buying enough to do the whole house. This switch is illuminated when off, single pole (only 1 switch in the circuit, not a 3- or 4-way), has decent quality construction and materials, but it's made in Korea, not the USA. This switch was simple and easy to install. The body is not large so it'll fit in older, small electrical boxes. It does NOT need a neutral wire as some other lighted switches do. This may be a plus if you have an older home with no neutral wire in your existing switch box, but current building codes require new construction to have a neutral wire to allow using the fancy switches available now that do require a neutral to operate properly. For my purposes, this switch is much too dim. I wanted one that made it easy to find in the dark. At 60+ years old, my eyes could barely see the light on this switch. The light is centered on the rocker and is probably a neon bulb which should last about a dozen years. My experience with neon bulbs in switches is that the bulbs begin to flicker, then fail, after a decade or so. Another illuminated switch I bought (from a big blue box store), the Cooper C7511, is equally dim (if not even dimmer), and 25% cheaper. Bottom Line: recommended only if you have young eyes or need a very dim lighted switch for, say, a bedroom. Otherwise, look elsewhere (like Leviton).
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 20, 2014
reviews.title: Somewhat stiff click action, very dim "locator light"
